Text:
This is a list of new clients we acquired at the
recent aristocrat party...

This is a list of the new vendors we've established
connections with through our tea distribution...
How's it going, Gamma?

Beta... Now that we have a clear goal in sight,
it's been hectic but rewarding.

Here is the price quote for the Midgar Newspaper ad
space you requested.

The MNA seems particularly interested in the plans
for the new store.
Thank you, Beta.

Telling them there will be a dedicated publication
section in the new store seems to have helped
soften their attitudes.

No point in quality products and information unless
there's a place to sell them.

Speaking of places to sell...I'm impressed you managed
to get a hold of that empty site in the city.

That...was the result of the first stages of the
process, examining which shares we would
buy up from the capital.

Without the shares issued by the capital, we wouldn't
be able to run a business for the aristocrats, and we
couldn't start a new company since there's a cap on
the number of issued shares.

And all that was left of the former Luna, Ltd. was
that land and a clothing business on the verge of
collapse.

From what I recall, a very capable old lady
originally ran the business...

Yes. Luna, Ltd. was even said to have been the go-to
place for clothing in the capital.
But then her granddaughter became possessed...

The Church arrested the girl, and Luna's reputation
fell into disrepute.

Still, the fact that she kept it going for ten years
from that point speaks to her stubbornness as a
businesswoman.
When I visited, the company was at its limits.

When I suddenly appeared out of nowhere, I seemed to
have made an impression on the old lady...Mrs. Luna.
...Because you tripped and fell in front of her?
Don't be mean, Beta!
...Although you might be spot on!
Oh dear...

It was our first meeting, and I tripped and fell
unceremoniously in front of Mrs. Luna...

But I pulled myself up and asked her outright, "Will
you sell me your company shares?"
Okay...?
And guess what she said...
...What did she say?
She said, "Wipe your nose first! It's bleeding!"
Heheh...!

Turned out I forgot to bring a handkerchief, so
Mrs. Luna wiped my nose for me.

Then she told me, "Go sell a hundred of these
handkerchiefs in a week."
So how did you sell them all?
I didn't.
Huh?!

Selling a hundred handkerchiefs wouldn't exceed the
scope of a "normal business." If that were enough to
make it a profitable business, the company wouldn't
be struggling.

I figured if I just went along with the assignment,
it would make me more of a subordinate than a
business manager, so...

I multiplied the number of handkerchiefs from
a hundred to a thousand instead.
You multiplied them instead?! Why...?

The company was dead, but the tradespeople who did
business with the company were alive and well.

Preparing a hundred handkerchiefs and selling them
won't give you a sustainable business, but if you can
prepare a thousand and sell them all, that's another
story.

So I told her I would do whatever it took to sell
these one thousand handkerchiefs.

It's also been our policy to first investigate where something
is made rather than sold as a means of protecting the
Garden's confidentiality.
And what did Mrs. Luna say?

She set out a condition for handing over her company
shares.

I would have to pay a penalty fee to the business
partners and tradespeople of the company if I
were to acquire the shares.

This was a natural condition for taking over the
clothing business since she was in a situation where
she would likely have had to sell her shares to pay
them off.

Well, it was a daily routine of running around
scavenging for money after that. Eta's wasteful
spending was my most formidable obstacle...!
Ahaha...! I completely understand!

Still, I managed to procure the penalty fee, but I
never made the payment.

Mrs. Luna had convinced the business partners and
tradespeople that if I could fully procure the penalty
fee, they should cooperate with my newly restructured
Luna, Ltd.

I guess their cooperation meant they'd continue their
dealings with the company, and you wouldn't have to
pay the penalty fee.

Yes. Not only that, but Mrs. Luna ultimately gave me
the company shares and property for free.

This was on the condition that, as the head of
Luna, Ltd., I would take on the name "Luna"
in her stead.

It seems her dream was to have her granddaughter
manage the business and take over under her name.
Then, once she built up the company's foundation,
she'd eventually rename it...

And that's how Luna, Ltd. in the Midgar Kingdom was
reborn and how I took on the name "Luna."

Wow, that's quite the origin story! And...one that
hits close to home.
How so?
Just like how Master Shadow saved us,
you saved the old lady and her business partners.
If so, it's all thanks to our lord...
